components.FreezedWarning.migrationText: Supply and borrow of {token} is disabled due to the ongoing migration. You can still repay and withdraw to migrate your token {here}
components.HealthFactor.caption: Health factor
components.HelpModal.AccessMaticMarketHe: How to access the Aave Polygon Market

Aave Polygon Market is the Aave Protocol market on Polygon Network (L2). Here you have access to similar assets as in the main Aave Market, but with lower transaction costs as you are using a L2 network.
Adding Polygon Mainnet is easy, please follow these steps
components.HelpModal.ApproximateBalanceH: Your aggregated balance shows the approximate value in USD of all the assets you have supplied. It fluctuates based on the evolution of prices.

Please note that if your supplied assets consist of stable-coins the approximate balance in USD could be slightly higher or lower than the stable-coin balance, due to fluctuations in the stable-coin peg.
components.HelpModal.BorrowInterestHelpM: Your interest rate will {stay} for the duration of your loan. Recommended for long-term loan periods and for users who prefer predictability.
Your interest rate will {fluctuate} based on the market. Recommended for short-term loans.
components.HelpModal.CollateralHelpModal: Adding and removing assets as collateral
Allows you to decide whether to use a supplied asset as collateral. An asset used as collateral will affect your borrowing power and health factor.
components.HelpModal.CooldownUnstakeHelp: You can only withdraw your assets from the Security Module after the cooldown period ends and the unstake window is active.
The cooldown period can be activated by pressing the ‘Activate Cooldown’ button. Once the time expires, you’re free to withdraw within the time frame of the unstake window.
If you fail to withdraw your assets during the unstake window, you need to activate the cooldown period again and wait for the next unstake window.
components.HelpModal.DelegationHelpModal: You can delegate your proposal/voting power to another Ethereum address without the AAVE/stkAAVE tokens leaving your wallet.
To delegate to another address or to get your power back, simply delegate again to the address you want. (eg. Recover your power by delegating to your own Ethereum address)
components.HelpModal.HealthFactorHelpMod: The health factor represents the safety of your loan derived from the proportion of collateral versus amount borrowed. Keep it above 1 to avoid liquidation.
components.HelpModal.LiquidationBonusHel: When a liquidation occurs, liquidators repay part or all of the outstanding borrowed amount on behalf of the borrower. In return, they can buy the collateral at a discount and keep the difference as a bonus!
components.HelpModal.LiquidationThreshol: This represents the threshold at which a borrow position will be considered undercollateralized and subject to liquidation for each collateral. For example, if a collateral has a liquidation threshold of 80%, it means that the loan will be liquidated when the debt value is worth 80% of the collateral value.
components.HelpModal.MaxLTVHelpModal.des: The Maximum Loan-to-Value ratio represents the maximum borrowing power of a specific collateral. For example, if a collateral has a LTV of 75%, the user can borrow up to 0.75 worth of ETH in the principal currency for every 1 ETH worth of collateral.
components.HelpModal.MinimumReceivedHelp: This is the minimum amount you are willing to receive as result of the swap. Take in consideration swap rates might change prior the execution of your swap transaction.
components.HelpModal.NetAPYHelpModal.des: Interest earned and paid including rewards on supply and borrow.
components.HelpModal.NotHaveEnoughFundsT: You don’t have enough funds in your wallet to repay the full amount. If you proceed to repay with your current amount of funds, you will still have a small borrowing position in your dashboard.
The threshold is dynamic and based on the quorum differential of votes for/against.

If the votes against the AIP only make up a small percentage, the threshold will remain the same. However, if the votes against the AIP are more substantial, then the threshold can be moved up so there must be more votes in favour for the AIP to pass.
components.HelpModal.TribeRewardHelpModa: The Fei Protocol governance has decided to give {tribe} rewards to variable borrowing of {fei} on Aave in {link}
For more information about the rewards and how to claim them, visit the {link}

This is offered strictly by the Fei Protocol and the Aave Protocol does not have any involvement in the TRIBE rewards. The Fei Protocol App is a third party application affiliated with Fei and not with Aave in any way.
components.HelpModal.VotingPowerCalculat: How is my voting power calculated?
Your voting power for this proposal is equivalent to your AAVE balance plus any delegated voting power you had at the moment the proposal was created.
Therefore, it might be different from your current voting power.
components.LiquidationRiskParametresInfo: Your health factor and loan to value determine the assurance of your collateral. To avoid liquidations you can supply more collateral or repay borrow positions. {link}
* If the health factor goes below 1, the liquidation of your collateral might be triggered.
Safety of your supplied collateral against the borrowed assets and its underlying value.
** If your loan to value goes above the liquidation threshold your collateral supplied may be liquidated.
Your current loan to value based on your collateral supplied.
components.MainnetWarning.mainnetOnly: This feature is only available on Ethereum Mainnet.
components.MarketNotSupported.descriptio: The feature you're trying to access is not supported on the currently selected market.

components.TxEstimationEditor.EditorModa: When the Ethereum network is congested the gas price for your transaction increases. You may need to increase your gas price in gwei for your transactions to be approved faster or wait for lower transaction cost over the network

components.caps.AvailableCapsHelpModal.b: This is the total amount available for you to borrow. You can borrow based on your collateral and until the borrow cap is reached.
components.caps.AvailableCapsHelpModal.s: This is the total amount that you are able to supply to in this reserve. You are able to supply your wallet balance up until the supply cap is reached.

components.caps.CapsHelpModal.borrowCapD: Borrow cap is the maximum amount that can be borrowed from this reserve.
components.caps.CapsHelpModal.supplyCapD: Supply cap is the maximum amount that can be supplied to this reserve.
components.caps.CapsTooltip.borrowCapNea: This asset has almost reached its borrow cap. There is only {availableValue} available to be borrowed from this market.
components.caps.CapsTooltip.borrowCapRea: This asset has reached its borrow cap. Nothing is available to be borrowed from this market.
components.caps.CapsTooltip.supplyCapNea: This asset has almost reached its supply cap. There can only be {availableValue} supplied to this market.
components.caps.CapsTooltip.supplyCapRea: This asset has reached its supply cap. Nothing is available to be supplied from this market.
components.eMode.EModeHelpModal.callToAc: While using E-Mode you will be restricted to do other type of borrowings. You can learn more in our {link}
components.eMode.EModeHelpModal.modalDes: Efficiency mode or E-mode allows higher borrowing limit (TVL) for assets within the same category.
components.eMode.EModeHelpModal.title: E-Mode
components.eMode.EModeIconWithTooltip.te: You have an increased borrowing power for this asset, because you are using E-mode {eModeCategory}
components.eMode.EModeModal.eModeDisable: Note: You can’t disable E-Mode as your current collateralization level is above 80%, disabling E-Mode can cause liquidation. To exit E-Mode supply or repay borrowed positions.

Note: The E-Mode feature is currently unavailable because you currently have borrowing positions in another category. In order to enable E-Mode for asset category {assetCategory} you will need to close your position in the other category. See our {link} to learn more.
components.eMode.EModeModal.eModeEnableN: Note: Enabling E-Mode only allows you to borrow assets belonging to the selected category {assetCategory}. Please visit out {link} to learn more about how it works and the applied restrictions.
components.eMode.EModeModal.efficiencyMo: E-Mode increases your borrowing power for a selected category of assets up to 99%. {link}
There are no asset matching the parameters
components.incentives.IncentivesInfoModa: Participating in this {symbol} reserve gives annualized rewards.
components.isolationMode.IsolatedAssetMo: Isolated assets can only be borrowed up to a specific debt ceiling. Once that is reached it will not be possible to borrow more.
As a security measure some newly listed assets have limited exposure until the Aave governance decides otherwise.
In Isolation mode you cannot supply other assets as collateral for borrowing. Assets used as collateral in Isolation mode can only be borrowed to a specific debt ceiling.
To exit isolation mode, you will need to repay all your borrowed positions and turn off the isolated asset being used as collateral from your dashboard.
To supply an asset in isolation mode you must not have any collateral enabled positions and no open borrow positions in your account.
components.isolationMode.IsolationModeBa: Asset cannot be used as collateral because another asset is used in isolation mode. You can exit isolation mode by repaying any borrowed positions and disabling collateral on that asset from the dashboard.
Learn more about isolation mode in our {link}.
Used as collateral in isolation mode
In Isolation mode you can only supply one isolated asset as collateral for borrowing. Other assets will not be able to be used as collateral for borrowing.
components.isolationMode.IsolationModeWa: Due to potential security risk this asset can be supplied as collateral in isolation mode only. Learn more in {link}.

modules.borrow.components.BorrowInterest: Choose either stable or variable APY for your loan. Please click on the desired rate type and read the info box for more information on each option.

You have selected the {rate}. The stable rate acts as a fixed rate in the short term but can be rebalanced in the longer term in response to market changes. The stable rate is not as impacted by fluctuations in the reserve.
You have selected the {rate}. The variable rate can increase and decrease depending on the amount of liquidity in the reserve.

The {rate} rate is disabled because you want to borrow more than 25% of the available liquidity ({availableLiquidityToBorrowStable} {poolReserveSymbol} at the moment). If you want to choose the stable rate please go back and select less than 25% to proceed.
You can't choose stable on reserve which you already using as collateral. Disable usage as collateral and try again.

modules.reward.screens.RewardMain.captio: Select the reward you want to claim or claim all rewards at once
modules.staking.components.AboutStakingM: Staking AAVE makes the protocol a bit safer in case of an emergency. For taking this risk you will receive AAVE. The AAVE tokens represent voting power in the protocol governance. In the case of a {upTo} of your staked assets can be slashed to cover the deficit.

Staking your Balancer Pool Token (BPT) makes the protocol a bit safer in case of an emergency. For taking this risk you will be rewarded with AAVE, BAL, and trading fees. In the case of a {upTo} of your staked assets can be slashed to cover the deficit. You can get BPT by depositing a combination of AAVE + ETH in the {balancerLiquidityPool}
How would you like to stake
modules.staking.components.CooldownInfoM: I understand how the cooldown ({cooldownPeriod}) and unstaking window ({unstakingWindowPeriod}) work
You will continue receiving rewards during the cooldown and unstake window.
The cooldown period is {cooldownPeriod}. After the {cooldownPeriod} of cooldown, you will enter the unstake window of {unstakeWindowPeriod}.
If you do not unstake within the 2 days unstake window you will need to activate the cooldown process again
modules.staking.components.RiskInfoPanel: There are risks involved with staking your assets. To learn more follow me {here}!
modules.staking.components.StakingWrappe: We couldn’t detect a wallet. Connect a wallet to stake.
modules.staking.screens.ActivateCooldown: You need to {activate} the cooldown before you can unstake your {asset} from the Security Module. This transaction is to {confirm} of the cooldown.
modules.staking.screens.StakeAmount.capt: How much would you like to stake?
modules.staking.screens.StakeAmount.desc: Staking {symbol} in the {module} helps to secure the protocol in exchange for {incentives}.
{asset} holders can stake their {asset} in the Safety Module and earn Safety Incentives. In the case of a {upTo} of your stake can be slashed to cover the deficit, providing an additional layer of protection for the protocol.
Remember my choice for next time

Stakers receive Safety Incentives in the form of AAVE tokens in exchange for taking this risk to secure the protocol. You will need to activate a {cooldownPeriod} before you are able to withdraw your stake.
